summary: generating webpages with basic UI elements
prompts: I need a landing page for a new fitness app called FitFlow. Can you create HTML with a hero section that has a large headline saying 'Transform Your Body in 30 Days', a subheading about personalized workout plans, and a bright green 'Start Free Trial' button? Also add a background image placeholder.

create a simple landing page with a hero section for my freelance design business. include a main heading, some descriptive text about my services, and two CTA buttons - one for 'View Portfolio' and another for 'Contact Me'

Hey, can you help me build a landing page? I want a hero section at the top with the title 'CloudSync - Your Files, Everywhere' and underneath it should say something like 'Secure cloud storage that works seamlessly across all your devices.' Put a blue 'Get Started' button and maybe a 'Learn More' link below that. Make it clean and modern looking with CSS.

Generate HTML and CSS for a product launch landing page. The hero section should have: a bold headline 'Introducing AirPods Pro Max', a tagline 'Premium sound. Unmatched comfort.', a large 'Pre-order Now' button (make it orange and eye-catching), and space for a product image on the right side. Use a gradient background from dark blue to purple.

I need a contact form for my website with fields for name, email, phone number, and message. Please add validation to make sure the email is in the correct format and all fields are required. Include a submit button that shows an alert when clicked.

Create an HTML contact form that validates user input. It should have: name (text), email (must be valid email format), subject (dropdown with options: General Inquiry, Support, Sales), and comments (textarea). Add JavaScript to check all fields are filled before submission and display error messages below each field if validation fails.

can you make a simple contact form page? just need basic fields like name email and message box. make sure it checks if the email looks right before letting them submit. also style it a bit with css so it doesn't look terrible

Build me a professional contact form with proper validation. Requirements: First Name, Last Name, Email Address, Phone (optional with format xxx-xxx-xxxx), Company Name (optional), Message (minimum 10 characters). Use regex for email and phone validation. When the submit button is clicked, validate all inputs and either show inline error messages in red or display a success message saying 'Thank you for contacting us!' if everything is valid.

I need help creating a responsive navigation bar with dropdown menus for my website. It should have a logo on the left, menu items in the center, and a hamburger menu for mobile screens. The dropdowns should appear on hover for desktop and on click for mobile. Can you provide the HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code?

Generate a modern navbar with dropdown submenus that works on all screen sizes. Main menu items: Home, Products (dropdown with Electronics, Clothing, Books), Services (dropdown with Consulting, Support), About, Contact. Make it sticky at the top and use a dark color scheme
can you make me a navigation bar that has dropdowns? needs to work on phones too. want it to collapse into those three lines on small screens

Create HTML/CSS code for a professional navigation header with multi-level dropdown menus. Requirements: 1) Fully responsive from mobile to desktop, 2) Smooth animations on hover/click, 3) Accessible with proper ARIA labels, 4) Should support nested dropdowns (at least 2 levels deep), 5) Include a search bar that hides on mobile. Use flexbox or grid for layout and vanilla CSS if possible.

I need a simple image gallery webpage with a grid of thumbnails that open in a lightbox when clicked. Can you create the HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for this? The gallery should have 6 images and be responsive.

Create an image gallery with thumbnail grid layout and lightbox functionality. When a thumbnail is clicked, it should open the full image in an overlay with navigation arrows to go to next/previous images. Also add a close button. Make it look modern and clean.

can you make me a photo gallery page? i want small preview images in a grid and when someone clicks on them they should pop up bigger with a dark background behind them. maybe 3 columns on desktop and 1 column on mobile

Build a complete HTML page with an image gallery featuring:
- Thumbnail grid (4x3 layout)
- Lightbox effect on click with fade-in animation
- Caption text below each thumbnail
- Keyboard navigation (arrow keys and ESC to close)
- Smooth transitions
Use placeholder images from Lorem Picsum or similar service.
I need a simple login form with username and password fields, plus a submit button. Can you create the HTML and CSS for this? Make it centered on the page with a clean, modern look.

Create a registration page that has fields for email, password, confirm password, and a checkbox for terms and conditions. Include basic validation like making sure passwords match. Just need the HTML/CSS/JavaScript code.
hey can u help me make a login/signup toggle form? like where users can switch between logging in and creating a new account on the same page. should have email and password fields for both

Generate a responsive login form with the following: email input field, password field with a show/hide toggle button, remember me checkbox, forgot password link, and a login button. Style it with a gradient background and rounded corners. Also add some hover effects on the button.

I need a product card component for an e-commerce site. It should have a product image at the top, the product name, price displayed prominently, and an 'Add to Cart' button at the bottom. Can you create the HTML and CSS for this?
Create a responsive product card with an image placeholder, title "Wireless Headphones", price $59.99, and a blue add to cart button. Make it look modern with some hover effects
hey can you help me build a simple product card? needs to show: - product photo - name of product - the price (with dollar sign) - add to cart button. just basic html/css nothing fancy

Generate HTML code for a product card grid layout with 3 cards. Each card should contain: an image (use placeholder URLs), product title, price tag with strikethrough original price and sale price, and an 'Add to Cart' button styled in green. Include CSS to make them look professional with shadows and rounded corners.

I need a footer for my website with three columns. First column should have 'About Us', 'Our Team', and 'Careers' links. Second column needs 'Privacy Policy', 'Terms of Service', and 'Contact' links. Third column should have social media icons for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn. Make it dark themed with white text.
create a simple footer section that has copyright text on the left side and social media icons on the right (twitter/x, youtube, tiktok). center align everything and use a light gray background

Can you help me build a responsive footer? It should have my company name 'TechFlow Solutions' at the top, then below that have two rows - one with navigation links (Home, Products, Support, Blog) and another row with social icons (GitHub, Discord, Reddit). Also add a copyright notice at the very bottom saying '© 2024 TechFlow Solutions. All rights reserved.'

Generate HTML and CSS for a minimal footer with just social media links (facebook, instagram, pinterest, email) centered horizontally. No other text or links needed, just the icons in a clean row with some hover effects

Can you create an HTML page with a search bar that shows autocomplete suggestions as the user types? I want it to suggest city names from a predefined list like New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Houston, Phoenix. Make it look modern with some CSS styling.
I need a simple search input with dropdown suggestions that appear below it. Just basic HTML/CSS/JavaScript that filters through a list of programming languages when someone starts typing

help me build a search box with autocomplete functionality similar to google's. it should have a clean white background, rounded corners, and show matching results in a dropdown list underneath. include some sample data to search through like product names or something

Generate code for a webpage that has a search bar at the top center. When users type, it should display autocomplete options fetched from an array of countries. Include hover effects on the suggestions and make them clickable. Also add a magnifying glass icon inside the search field.

I need a simple modal dialog for my website that appears when someone clicks a 'Subscribe' button. It should have a title that says 'Join Our Newsletter', an email input field, and two buttons - 'Subscribe' and 'Cancel'. Can you create the HTML, CSS and JavaScript for this?

create a popup window that shows product details when hovering over an item. should have an image placeholder, product name, price, and description. make it look modern with rounded corners and a shadow

Hi! Can you help me build a confirmation modal? When users try to delete something, I want a popup asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this item?' with Yes/No buttons. Please include the CSS to make it overlay the whole screen with a dark background.

Generate code for a cookie consent popup that appears at the bottom of the page when it loads. Include text like 'We use cookies to improve your experience' with an 'Accept' button and a link to 'Learn More'. Make sure it can be dismissed and doesn't show again after accepting.

Can you create an HTML accordion component for a FAQ section? I need it to have smooth expand/collapse animations and only allow one question to be open at a time. Include some sample FAQs about shipping and returns.

I need a simple FAQ accordion for my website. Just basic HTML, CSS and vanilla JavaScript. Make it so users can click on questions to reveal answers. Add like 5 example questions about a coffee shop business

Build me a responsive accordion FAQ section using modern CSS. It should work on mobile and desktop, with + and - icons that change when expanded. Style it with a clean, minimalist look with subtle shadows. Include dummy content about web hosting services.

hey can u make an faq accordion thing? should have clickable headers that show/hide the answer text below. make it look professional with nice colors (maybe blue theme?) and put in some placeholder questions about online courses or something

Can you create a simple HTML page with tabs? I need 3 tabs: Home, About, and Contact. The Home tab should say 'Welcome to our website', About should have 'We are a tech company founded in 2020', and Contact should show 'Email us at info@example.com'. Make it work with just HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

I need a tabbed interface for a product page. Make tabs for Description, Specifications, and Reviews. Use some nice CSS styling with a blue color scheme. The tabs should switch content when clicked without refreshing the page

help me build a responsive tab component that works on mobile too. i want 4 tabs for a dashboard - overview, analytics, reports, and settings. just put placeholder text in each tab for now but make sure the active tab is highlighted differently

Generate the code for a vertical tab layout instead of horizontal. I'm making a documentation site and need tabs on the left side for: Getting Started, Installation, API Reference, and Examples. Include smooth transitions when switching between tabs and maybe add some icons next to each tab label if possible.

I need a simple breadcrumb navigation for my website. The structure should be Home > Products > Electronics > Laptops. Make it with HTML and CSS, and style it so the links are separated by '>' symbols

can you create a breadcrumb component that shows the current page hierarchy? i want it to look modern with a light gray background and the last item should be bold to indicate the current page. here's my site structure: Home / About Us / Our Team / Leadership

Generate HTML/CSS code for breadcrumb navigation. Should work for this path: Dashboard → Settings → Account → Security. Add hover effects on the links and make sure the current page (Security) is not clickable.

Build me a responsive breadcrumb trail using divs and spans. Need it to show: Main Page / Category / Subcategory / Product Name. On mobile it should collapse to just show ... / Product Name. Include the CSS to make this work
I need a simple HTML page with a progress bar that goes from 0 to 100%. Can you include some CSS to make it blue and animated? Also add a percentage label that updates as it progresses
create a loading spinner animation using pure CSS. make it a circle that spins continuously. i want the html and css code together in one file

Build me a webpage that shows 3 different types of loading indicators: a pulsing dot animation, a skeleton screen loader for a card component, and a traditional horizontal progress bar. Use modern CSS with nice colors.

hey can you help me make a file upload progress indicator? need the html/css/javascript to show a progress bar that fills up when uploading files, with a cancel button and showing the filename being uploaded

I need a simple HTML page with a toast notification that appears in the bottom right corner when a button is clicked. The toast should say 'Item added to cart!' and automatically disappear after 3 seconds. Can you include some basic CSS to make it look nice with a green background?

create a webpage that shows different types of alert messages - success, warning, error, and info. each should have an appropriate color (green, yellow, red, blue) and an X button to close them. make them look modern with rounded corners

Can you help me build an HTML page with a notification system? I want floating toast messages that slide in from the top of the screen. Include examples for 'Login successful', 'Network error', and 'File uploaded'. Add some smooth animations with CSS.

Generate code for a basic web page that displays dismissible alert banners at the top. I need it to show important messages to users like 'Your session will expire in 5 minutes' with a close button. Also add a function to dynamically create new alerts using JavaScript

I need a responsive sidebar menu with collapsible sections for a documentation website. Each section should have a chevron icon that rotates when expanded/collapsed. Include categories like 'Getting Started', 'API Reference', and 'Tutorials' with some sample sub-items under each. Make it work with vanilla JavaScript and CSS.

Create an HTML page with a left sidebar navigation that has expandable menu items. The sidebar should be 250px wide and have a dark theme. Add smooth animations when sections open/close. Include at least 3 main sections with nested links inside them

can you help me build a collapsible sidebar menu? i want it to look modern with icons next to each menu item. when a section is clicked it should show/hide its children items. also make the active section highlighted somehow. just html css and js please

Generate a complete webpage with a collapsible sidebar navigation menu. The sidebar should stick to the left side of the page, have multiple nested levels (at least 2 deep), and include a hamburger menu button to show/hide the entire sidebar on mobile. Use Font Awesome icons and make sure only one section can be expanded at a time (accordion style). Include some dummy content in the main area too.

I need a webpage with a table that shows employee data including name, department, salary, and hire date. The table should have clickable column headers for sorting and pagination controls at the bottom to show 10 rows at a time. Can you create this with HTML, CSS and JavaScript?

Create an HTML page with a sortable data table for a product inventory. Include columns for Product ID, Name, Category, Price, and Stock Quantity. Add pagination that displays 20 items per page and next/previous buttons. Make it look professional with some basic styling.

hey can you help me build a simple webpage that has a table with sorting and pagination? i want to display customer orders with order number, customer name, date, total amount, and status. should work without any external libraries just plain html/css/js

Generate a complete HTML file with a dynamic table component that displays user data from a JavaScript array. The table needs: sorting functionality when clicking headers, pagination with 15 records per page, page number buttons, and some CSS to make it visually appealing. Include sample data for at least 50 users with fields: ID, username, email, registration date, and account status.

Can you create an HTML page for a blog post about coffee brewing? I need a main header with the title 'The Perfect Pour Over', a subheader for the author and date, the main article content area, and at the bottom a comment section where readers can leave their name and comment.

I need help building a simple blog post layout. Include a large header at the top, space for the blog content in the middle, and a comments section at the end with input fields for name, email, and comment text. Make it clean and readable please

generate a webpage for my travel blog post!! should have: 
- eye-catching header saying "Adventures in Tokyo" 
- area for the main blog text 
- comment section with form fields 
- maybe add some basic CSS to make it look nice?

Create a basic HTML/CSS blog post template with a prominent H1 header for the post title, metadata section for author and publish date, main content container, and a functional comment form with fields for commenter name, email (optional), and their comment. Include submit and cancel buttons for the comment form.

I need HTML and CSS for a testimonial carousel that automatically rotates through customer reviews every 5 seconds. Include at least 3 sample testimonials with customer names, their job titles, and star ratings. Make it responsive and add navigation dots at the bottom.

can you create a simple review section for my website? just want something clean that shows 4 customer reviews in a grid layout with their profile pictures (use placeholder images), the review text, and 5-star ratings. nothing too fancy

Build me a testimonial slider with left/right arrow navigation. It should display one testimonial at a time on mobile and three testimonials side by side on desktop. Include smooth transitions and make the active testimonial slightly larger than the others. Use modern CSS with a glassmorphism effect for the cards.

Help me make a reviews display component that pulls from this data:
- John Smith, 5 stars, "Excellent service and fast delivery!"
- Sarah Johnson, 4 stars, "Good quality, minor shipping delay"
- Mike Chen, 5 stars, "Exceeded expectations, will order again"
- Emily Davis, 5 stars, "Best purchase I've made this year"

I want it to show all reviews at once with a subtle fade-in animation when the page loads

I need a simple newsletter subscription form for my website. It should have an email input field, a submit button, and maybe a heading that says 'Subscribe to our Newsletter'. Can you create the HTML and CSS for this?
create a newsletter signup form with email validation. should look modern and clean with rounded corners and a nice color scheme

Hey, can you help me build a subscription form? I want it to have an email input box, first name and last name fields, and a subscribe button. Also add a checkbox for 'I agree to receive marketing emails' with some basic styling please

Generate HTML code for a minimal email subscription form. Just need: title text 'Get Updates', email input with placeholder text, submit button labeled 'Join'. Make it responsive and center it on the page with CSS.

I need a simple webpage with a settings panel that has toggle switches for notifications (email, SMS, push) and a group of checkboxes for selecting interests like sports, technology, music, and gaming. Make it look clean with some basic CSS styling.

Can you create an HTML form with toggle switches to enable/disable features (dark mode, auto-save, spell check) and below that add checkbox groups for selecting multiple languages? Use modern CSS to make the toggles look like iOS-style switches

help me build a preferences page that includes: 1) toggle switches for privacy settings (share location, share data, personalized ads) 2) checkboxes for selecting notification types the user wants to receive 3) make sure both are properly labeled and accessible

Generate HTML/CSS/JS code for a subscription management interface. I want toggle switches to turn on/off different subscription tiers (basic, premium, enterprise) where only one can be active at a time, and checkbox groups for optional add-ons that users can select multiple of. Include some JavaScript to handle the toggle logic.

I need to create a simple survey page with radio buttons for collecting user preferences. Can you generate HTML code with 3 questions: 1) Age group (18-25, 26-35, 36-45, 46+), 2) Preferred contact method (Email, Phone, Text), and 3) How satisfied are you with our service (Very satisfied, Satisfied, Neutral, Dissatisfied). Make it look clean with some basic CSS.

help me build a customer feedback form with radio button options. should have questions about product quality (excellent/good/average/poor) and whether they'd recommend us (yes/no/maybe). just basic html is fine

Generate a webpage with a quiz-style survey using radio buttons. I want 5 multiple choice questions about coffee preferences: favorite roast type, brewing method, time of day for coffee, cups per day, and preferred coffee shop chain. Each question should have 4 radio button options. Please include submit and reset buttons at the bottom.

Could you create an HTML form for an event registration survey? Need radio buttons for: meal preference (vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, no restrictions), t-shirt size (S, M, L, XL, XXL), and session preference (morning 9-12pm, afternoon 1-4pm, evening 5-8pm). Also add labels and make sure only one option can be selected per question. Thanks!

I need a dropdown menu for filtering products by category. The options should be: Electronics, Clothing, Home & Garden, Sports, and Books. Make it styled with a light blue background and rounded corners. When someone selects an option, it should display the selected value below the dropdown.

Can you create an HTML select element with options for filtering search results by date range? Include: Last 24 hours, Last 7 days, Last 30 days, Last year, and All time. Add some basic CSS to make it look modern

help me build a filter dropdown for a job listing page that lets users filter by employment type (full-time, part-time, contract, internship, temporary). make sure it has a default 'All Types' option and uses bootstrap classes if possible

Generate code for a country selector dropdown menu. It should have at least 15 major countries as options, start with 'Select a country' as placeholder text, and include JavaScript to console.log the selected country when changed. Style it to be 250px wide with a border.

I need a simple HTML page with a date picker for selecting appointment dates. Can you create one that lets users pick a date from a calendar dropdown? Make it look clean and modern with some basic CSS styling.

Create a webpage that has both a date selector and a time selector. I want users to be able to pick their delivery date and preferred time slot. Include some JavaScript to show the selected date and time below the pickers when they make a selection.

can you help me build a html form with a datetime picker? need it for a booking system where people select when they want their service. also add a submit button that shows an alert with the chosen date/time

Generate code for a responsive web page with multiple date inputs - one for start date, one for end date. Add validation so the end date can't be before the start date. Style it with a blue color scheme and make sure it works on mobile devices too.

I need a simple HTML page with a file upload area that supports drag and drop. It should have a dashed border and change color when you hover files over it. Include some text that says 'Drag files here or click to browse'

Can you create a drag-and-drop file uploader component? I want it to show file previews after uploading, support multiple files, and display the file names and sizes. Make it look modern with some nice CSS styling and maybe add a progress bar too

Build me a webpage with a file upload zone where users can drag and drop images. Should have: 
- A drop area with an upload icon
- Support for only image files (jpg, png, gif)
- Show thumbnails after dropping
- A button to clear all files
- Basic JavaScript to handle the drag/drop events
hey can u make a basic drag n drop file upload thing? just need the html/css/js code for a box where i can drop files and it shows what files were added. nothing fancy just make it work
I need a simple HTML5 video player with custom controls. Can you create one with play/pause, volume slider, and a progress bar? The controls should be styled with a dark theme and appear on hover.

Build me a webpage with a video player that has custom controls instead of the default browser ones. I want buttons for play, pause, skip forward 10 seconds, skip back 10 seconds, and a fullscreen toggle. Make it look modern with rounded corners and a blue color scheme
hey can u make a basic video player with html/css/js? need custom controls at the bottom - play button, timeline scrubber, volume, and current time display. nothing fancy just clean and functional

Create a responsive video player webpage with custom controls that work on mobile and desktop. Include play/pause toggle, mute button, volume control, seek bar with time tooltips, and playback speed options (0.5x, 1x, 1.5x, 2x). Style it with a minimalist white and gray design.

I need a pricing table for my SaaS product. We have 3 tiers: Basic ($9/mo), Pro ($29/mo), and Enterprise ($99/mo). Basic includes 5 projects and email support. Pro has unlimited projects, priority support, and API access. Enterprise adds custom integrations, dedicated account manager, and SLA. Make it look modern with HTML and CSS.

Can you create a comparison table for different hosting plans? Free plan: 1GB storage, 10GB bandwidth, SSL certificate. Starter plan ($5/month): 10GB storage, 100GB bandwidth, SSL, email support. Business plan ($15/month): 50GB storage, unlimited bandwidth, SSL, priority support, automatic backups. Make the recommended plan stand out.

generate html code for a pricing section with 3 columns. left column: starter $19, middle: professional $49 (mark as most popular), right: team $99. include checkmarks for features each plan has and X marks for what they don't. all plans get core features, professional adds advanced analytics and integrations, team adds everything plus white label options

Build me a simple HTML pricing table comparing two subscription options - monthly and yearly. Monthly is $12/month billed monthly. Yearly is $99/year (save 31%). Both should show the same features: Unlimited access, Cloud storage, Mobile app, Customer support. Add a toggle switch at the top to switch between monthly and yearly views.

Can you create an HTML timeline component that shows the major milestones of a startup company? I need it to display events like 'Founded - Jan 2020', 'Series A Funding - Aug 2021', 'Product Launch - Mar 2022', and 'IPO - Nov 2023'. Make it vertical with connecting lines between events.

I need a simple horizontal timeline for my portfolio website showing my career progression. It should have 5 points: graduation in 2018, first job at Tech Corp in 2019, promotion to senior developer in 2021, team lead position in 2022, and current role as architect starting 2024. Include some basic CSS to make it look professional with blue accent colors.
help me build a timeline component with html/css that alternates events on left and right sides. just need something basic to show historical events for a school project about world war 2

Generate code for a responsive timeline webpage that displays project phases. The events should be: Phase 1: Planning (Q1 2024), Phase 2: Design (Q2 2024), Phase 3: Development (Q3-Q4 2024), Phase 4: Testing (Q1 2025), Phase 5: Launch (Q2 2025). I want it to look modern with cards for each event and it should work on mobile devices too. Use flexbox or grid if possible.

Can you create an HTML/CSS user profile card that has a circular avatar image on the left side, with the user's name, job title, and a short bio on the right? Make it look modern with some subtle shadows and maybe a gradient background.
I need a simple profile card component with an avatar image at the top, username below it, and social media icons at the bottom. Just basic HTML and inline CSS is fine

Generate a responsive user profile card layout that displays: profile picture (rounded corners), full name in bold, email address, location with a pin icon, and a 'Follow' button. Should work on mobile too. Use flexbox if possible.

help me build a profile card ui element!! needs to show user avatar (make it 100x100px), their display name, a status indicator (like online/offline dot), and maybe 2-3 lines for a description. keep it clean and minimal pls
Can you create an HTML page for a shopping cart that shows a list of items with their names, prices, quantities, and a remove button for each item? Also include a total price at the bottom.

I need a simple shopping cart interface with a table displaying products. Each row should have: product image thumbnail, name, unit price, quantity selector (dropdown or input), subtotal, and delete icon. Add 'Continue Shopping' and 'Checkout' buttons at the bottom. Make it responsive with some basic CSS styling.

Generate a basic shopping cart page that displays items in cards format instead of a table. Each card should show the product details and have + and - buttons to adjust quantity. Include a sidebar that shows order summary with subtotal, tax, and total

build me a shopping cart ui with these items hardcoded for now: Nike Shoes ($89.99, qty 2), Wireless Headphones ($149.00, qty 1), Coffee Maker ($79.50, qty 1). add update and remove buttons for each item, show individual totals and grand total. use modern css with flexbox

I need a dashboard layout with 4 widget containers - one large container at the top spanning the full width for a chart, and 3 equal-sized containers below it in a row for KPI cards. Make it responsive with CSS Grid

create an html page for a simple admin dashboard. should have a sidebar on the left with navigation, and the main area should have 6 widget containers arranged in a 3x2 grid. each widget should have a header section and content area with borders

Can you help me build a dashboard layout? I want widget containers that look like cards with shadows. Need a header row with 3 stat widgets, then below that 2 columns - left column has 2 stacked widgets, right column has 1 tall widget. Use flexbox please

Generate a clean dashboard webpage with widget containers. Top row: 4 small metric boxes side by side. Middle row: 2 medium sized containers for graphs. Bottom row: 1 large container for a data table. Include placeholder content and make the widgets have rounded corners with a light gray background

I need a simple cookie consent banner for my website. It should have Accept All, Reject All, and Customize buttons. Make it stick to the bottom of the page with a dark background and white text. Include some basic text about how we use cookies to improve user experience.

Can you create an HTML/CSS privacy notice popup that appears when users first visit the site? I want it to be GDPR compliant with checkboxes for different cookie categories (necessary, functional, analytics, advertising). Add a link to 'Privacy Policy' and make it responsive for mobile devices too

Generate a minimal cookie banner with just 'We use cookies' text and an 'OK' button. Style it to float in the bottom right corner, semi-transparent background, small and unobtrusive. Should disappear when clicked.

help me build a cookie consent modal that blocks the rest of the page content until the user makes a choice. Include options for essential cookies, performance cookies, and targeting cookies with toggle switches for each. Add explanatory text for each category and make sure there's both an 'Accept Selected' and 'Accept All' button. use modern CSS with a clean design

I need a 404 error page that includes a search bar, links to the homepage, contact page, and popular sections. Make it friendly with a message like 'Oops! Page not found' and maybe add a simple illustration placeholder

Can you create an HTML page for a 404 error? It should have: a heading saying the page doesn't exist, a brief apology message, a button to go back home, links to main site sections (About, Services, Blog, Contact), and styled with some basic CSS to look professional

generate a custom 404 page with navigation menu at the top (Home | Products | Support | About Us), large 404 text, explanation that the page was moved or deleted, a 'Go Back' button using JavaScript history.back(), and a footer with sitemap links

Build me a 404 error webpage. Include nav options to return to the main site, maybe suggest some popular pages the user might be looking for, and add a contact form or email link so users can report the broken link. Keep it simple but functional with HTML/CSS
